thread.title: College Football Powerhouse Surges To No. 1 in Updated Recruiting Rankings After 5-Star Addition
thread.title_full: College Football Powerhouse Surges To No. 1 in Updated Recruiting Rankings After 5-Star Addition

author: J.C. Shelton
title: College Football Powerhouse Surges To No. 1 in Updated Recruiting Rankings After 5-Star Addition
text:
There is a new No. 1 in class of 2026 college football recruiting rankings after a massive commitment on Wednesday.
Head coach Lincoln Riley and the USC Trojans previously held the top spot after jumping the Oregon Ducks on March 10. However, USC's lead was short lived, as five-star wide receiver Tristen Key's commitment has shaken things up atop the rankings.
Keys plays for Hattiesburg (Mississippi) High School. The 6-foot-2.5, 185-pound wideout is rated as the No. 1 wide receiver, the No. 1 player in the state and the No. 3 recruit overall, per On3 composite rankings.
Multiple college football powerhouses were in the hunt for a pledge from Keys before Wednesday's announcement, including LSU, Alabama, Miami, Texas A&M and Tennessee.
But it was the Tigers and head coach Brian Kelly that received the good news from Keys, who committed to LSU as the latest highly-coveted wide receiver to join the fold in Baton Rouge.
Despite having only seven commitments, including Keys, LSU's 2026 class has jumped USC for the No. 1 spot (On3). The Trojans hold the most commitments in the nation with 15.
BREAKING: Five-Star WR Tristen Keys has Committed to LSU, he tells me for
— Hayes Fawcett (@Hayesfawcett3)[@on3recruits]
The No. 1 WR in the ‘26 Class chose the Tigers over Tennessee, Alabama, & Texas A&M
“Once A Tiger, Always A Tiger[#WRTS]”[https://t.co/r9n15cVAMP][pic.twitter.com/HhGoLRPYLA][March 19, 2025]
Kelly and Co. appear to have kept momentum rolling after signing the No. 9 class in the 2025 cycle, as the Tigers currently hold the lead over USC, Oregon, Texas A&M and Auburn for 2026.
While there is still a wealth of time left in the cycle, LSU contending for the nation's top class is a welcomed sign for Tigers' faithful after a four-loss season in 2024.
LSU began spring practice last week and will culminate the period with a practice open to fans on April 12.
The Tigers will open the 2025 season at Clemson on Aug. 30.
